ParentCompanyName: Air Liquide Electronics U. S. LP

_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: Original manufacturer of piping,valves,pump,tank complied with applicable standards (ex.ASTMD1998-06
_prev_prog_2.Description: Liquid aqueous hydrochloric acid is stored in a bulk tank and pumped to stations to fill smaller containers. Bulk tank is located in a diked area. Piping is either double-containment or located within a spill control area and funneled to IWW spill containment via drains/trenches.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan executive summary to comply with 40 CRF ? 68.155 as amended by [61 FR 31726, June 20, 1996, as amended at 69 FR 18831, Apr. 9, 2004].

Location: Air Liquide Electronics US LP, Dallas Chemical Center, 13546 North Central Expressway, Dallas, TX 75243

The stationary source located at Air Liquide?s Dallas Chemical Center includes a 9,000 gallon (single wall, vertical) tank of aqueous toxic liquid.

The chemical specific accidental release and accident prevention steps are those to mitigate risk from an aqueous chemical release.

This facility complies with EPA?s accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.

Dallas Chemical Center utilizes the following accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:
a) ?management of change? to ensure the covered process is not altered without a safety review
b) secondary spill containment for the bulk tank
c) conductivity probes at the spill containment to ensure identification of process fluid leakage into the containment
d) manual emergency shutdown system
e) operator training to ensure correct operating procedure (SOP)
f) safety training 
g) manual isolation valves
h) tertiary spill containment to ensure potentially toxic fluids are treated through an approved waste water system,
to safeguard the system, ensure a safe range of operation, and actively mitigate events that fall outside of those parameters.

Air Liquide?s Dallas Chemical Center location has never had an accident involving the covered aqueous toxic liquid that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

Air Liquide?s Dallas Chemical Center location utilizes an Emergency Action Plan, Emergency Response, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP?s), and operator training to ensure personnel are trained to identify and respond to accident and emergency situations.

Air Liquide?s Dallas Chemical Center loc

ation emergency response to accidental releases from the covered process includes: stopping equipment and isolating any equipment which may leak fluid in addition to ensuring spill containment is handled according to safe practices. The Dallas Chemical Center is assisted by the Air Liquide Electronics US LP HAZMAT team.


Planned changes to improve safety:
As is our policy at Air Liquide, we continue to audit our process(es) for possibilities of improvement to process, operational methods, and new technology to lower risk. In conclusion to our most recent Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), Air Liquide?s Dallas Chemical Center location plans to:
1. investigate additional leak risk mitigation for single walled pipes within containment areas
2. expand emergency action plan and safety shower inspection procedure to clarify actions performed if plant water supply is compromised
3. verify emergency shutdown alarm can be clearly heard in all outside locations
4. investigate backup power supply for lighting exterior to the building(s)
5. investigate options for quickly knowing if a worker is incapacitated in the event a person was working alone in the process area
6. re-label valves for process for identification purposes
7. investigate possibility of additional valve to limit the potential for leakage on lines containing single isolation valves
8. expand and clarify shutdown procedures in SOPs
9. add ?as built? process and instrumentation diagrams to document retention
10. investigate additional spill containment options in case of primary containment failure
to improve our process to be implemented by January 1, 2008.
